bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Josiah Quincy, November 21, 1893
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, November 21, 1893.
Mr. Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State.
Accounts and returns of the Consular Agent at Elmina, for the quarter ended September 30, 1893.
Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, November 21, 1893.
Honorable Josiah Quincy, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor to transmit herewith the Accounts and returns of the Consular Agent at Elmina, for the quarter ended September 30, 1893 as per subjoined list of inclosures.
I have the honor to be, sir: your obedient servant,
Beverly Y. Payne U. S. Vice Consul
1. Arrivals and Departures of American vessels 2. Summary of Business. 3. Digest of Invoice Books.
